attributes.action: offer signifcant tax incentives to manufacturers who eliminate non-reuseable packaging
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Reducing Waste & Recycling

An industry has been created out of waste management.

Thatcher put the scrap dealer [and his horse] out of business by introducing an expensive licensing scheme.

Once sorted, perhaps cleaned or repaired, your cast offs could become another’s heirloom. Think eBay or FreeCycle.

We have been able to create biodegradeable starch based food wrapping since the 1980’s. Why use plastic? It is a legislative requirement to have separate wrapping on organic foods.

It has surely always been illogical to use landfill as a means of waste disposal. Now we dump in Third World.

The solution is simple.

Legislation should be introduced to make it possible for all consumers to return non-biodegradable or non recycle-able packaging to their immediate point of origin.

We welcome the return of deposit paid returnable glass containers; independent scrap dealers; & the withdrawal of all food related plastic packaging.

More food outlets should be encouraged, through tax incentives rather than fines, to design re-useable containers. 

This is not a difficult problem. It has simply been managed from the wrong perspective for too long.
